text: Draft - Vintage 2011 - Light funk and sour lemon. Cloudy gold. Acidic up front with citrus and some funk. Nice and bright with a dry finish.

Hand bottle from clockwork not sure how or when he acquired enjoyed while watching Taboo. Dark dusty still orange. Nose is sharp acidic citrus and wood. Tastes of horseblanket, lemon, acid, woody. Still a sharp citric nature to this. Not half bad

26/3/15 bag in box golden hazy flat brett wood sweet and sour
oro velata piatta bretta legno agrodolce
Troubele donkergele kleur. De geur is vrij zwak fris zurig. De smaak is deeg, licht zitroenzurig en heel droog op het einde. Misschien iets te droog op voor mijn smaak.

Bag in box. A hazy amber beer with no head. The aroma has notes of lemons, brettanomyces, and caramel. The flavor is sour with notes of lemons, brettanomyces, malt, and caramel, leading to a tart finish.

Bag in a [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - orange pour with no head. Medium sour fruity with notes of grapefruit, some apple notes, light apricot, straw, light wood, medium sour fruity into the close.
Tap @ Kulminator, Antwerp. Deep golden pour with no head. Tons of apple juice, funky, light apple skin and some light vinegar. Good!
5L Bag in a Box - Election Day Beer Pong November 8th - pours gold no head - nose/taste of lemon, horsey funk, dusty apple, oaky vanilla - medium body
Pour out of a 5L bag. Hazy golden pour with no head. Mild funk, fruit and spice like aromas. Light barnyard, leather, fruit, and mellow wild flavors.
Tap @ Kulminator. Pours still hazy darkish orange. Aromas of apple juice, deep funk, mould, apricots, citrus. Taste has apricot, apple juice, mango, citrus, mould, orange.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2013. Clear golden, no head. Aroma sour and light fruity with pear, apple and wood. Taste is sour and fruity with apple and wood, yet malty with a malty and dry finish. Fresh and fruity.

Draught @ Café Rose Red. Aroma is interesting and exceptional with fruits and solvent. Flavour is rather tart and somewhat sour with grapefruit, some leathery tones, chlorine and hints of lactic acid. Quite sour for an unblended lambic. The industrial off-flavours disturb a bit here.
Fast klare kräftig goldene Farbe, kein Schaum. Geruch säuerlich fruchtig, holzig. Geschmack sehr sauer, kraut, Gewürze, leicht holzig, gut.
Hazy orange color with no head. Aroma is citrus, citrus, citrus. Taste is sour citrus, acidic. Flat. Typical Timmermans I suppose...

brownish color, berry-like smell with some funk, very nice delicate aroma, sweet start, lots of fruit, apple, pear, little citric taste as well, some bitterness, really sour, medium dry, light moutfeel

(Draught/bag-in-box at Kulminator, Antwerpen, 15 Oct 2015. Vintage 2011) Hazy brownish yellow colour with foamy, white head. Fruity, sourish nose with oak wood, cellar, grapefruit and unripe green grapes. Fruity, tart taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, green grapes, cellar, stable and a dry and tart finish. Medium body, dry. Musty and tasty traditional lambic. Nice one.

(2011 lambic on cask @ Grote Dorst, Eizeringen, Nov 15 2015) Pours very hazy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of lemon yoghurt, cut grass, flowers, wet sulfurous earth. Palate is dominated by a creamy lemon juice and yoghurt lactic character with wet earth funk underneath. A little damp basement and wood on the finish but not much, smooth and really lemon dominated. Light-med body with no carb. Kind of meh. I felt it was lacking in funk and complexity but the acid profile made it tough to drink in volume, so not refreshing.

[9/20/15] Cask at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst in Eizeringen. Clear golden. Great funky aroma with oak, cobwebs, and fruits. Dry sour flavor with oak, citrus. Quite light-bodied. Really good and refreshing.

On tap at Grote Dorst. Pours slight hazy orange with a few bubbles. Aroma of light tart fruits, a floral note, yoghurt, light citrus and light funk. Flavour is moderate acidic with a soft mellow palate. Above light bodied with flat carbonation.
Keg at kulminator. Pours hazy orange, nose is funky, oak, toffee, taste is dry, sour, toffee, vanilla, fruit.
Draft at Kulminator. Aroma of horseblanket and oldness. Taste has tart, old hop, barnyard and oak. Nice easy lambic.

Draught: Timmermans Tumbler/Shaker:
Clear golden orange body with no head.
Aromas of wood, light fruity, light funky...
Flavour is good tart/sour, light dry, yoghurt sour, grapes, wood...
Aftertaste is tart with grapes, yoghurt sour and some wood.
Low to no carbo, medium bodied, dry watery mouthfeel. Nice stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Brown orange, no foam. Weak aroma, light sour taste. Very Refreshing drink. (Antwerpen 201507)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 version from a bag in a box at Cotteridge Wines tasting room; clear golden yellow pour with a tiny bubbly translucent head, aroma has funk and sharp cider apples, taste is lip puckering sour, with some barnyard funk, a hint of sharp lemons, soft carbs.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 AVERAGING 2 RATES:

From barrel at Toer de Geuze 2015. Smell is very acid-like, vinegar, lemon. Very heavy acid, not easy on the stomache. Not very pleasant. Very weard Ive had it before and then I apparently mentioned it needed more sourness. While this one was sour as hell. Total Score: 3.2 

Earlier Rating: 12/12/2014 Total Score: 3.8On tap at Kulminator. Pours dark orange. Nose is bread, citrus. Taste is little sour, tarty, grapes. Couldve benefited from more sourness.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2015 Offered as a surprise at ZBF, a rare treat indeed to taste this in its pure form. Came from a small plastic keg. Very slightly hazy light blonde colour and, as expected from an unblended lambic, no head whatsoever. The aroma and flavour have all the elegance, complexity and tartness youd expect from an old lambic: tons of sour berries, lemon peel, leather, pineapple freshness, sour yoghurt, wood, basal wheatiness, dry white wine, old sherry, wet hay, apples; soft acidity, more easy lactic sourness than sharp citric sourness as youd expect from an old lambic, very fruity, very wheaty, very quenching and very complex, with a noble woody tannins drought in the finish. Soft sourness is key here, this is extremely refreshing. A draft sample at In De Verzekering Tegen De Grote Dorst proved a bit sharper, more lemony and even more refreshing; needless to say, each batch will be different, as is essential to lambic.  I remember how difficult it was to obtain this kind of beer when I started getting interested in it, more than a dozen years ago, but I am glad that the epitome of sour beer styles gains so much attention nowadays (thank you, American craft beer geeks...). Very nice way to kick off a tiring tasting session at ZBF. Too bad Timmermans is in the clutches of John Martins, I guess, but even they have apparently understood that it is worthwile to confront the beer festival visitor with the basic thing their commercial lambic are made of. John Martins "rises in my esteem", if I may litterally translate Dutch idiom...

Pours unclear blonde .
Smell is funk , not intense . 
Taste is sharp sour , bit metallic , Boiled vegetables . Ok
Tap @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Let hazy yellow with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 120714

Draught. Hazy hay yellow liquid with small white head. Aroma of grain, apple skin, lemon and bread. Taste is dry and light sour with notes of apples and lemon. Medium bodied with very low carbonation. OK.

On tap at Grote Dorst, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small bubbly head. Nose brings out light funk, feet, and lemony notes. Flavour is very citric, one of the most citric / lemony unblended lambic Ive had, with very light funk. Intensely citric and tart, with a very puckering finish. Solid stuff - cool to try the base beer before Timmermans destroys it with sugar.

Verre dun cask au Café Red Rose (Brugge). Arômes assez puissants de vieux lambic. Pointe de vinaigre. Robe blonde et limpide, aucune effervescence ou mousse. En bouche, la présence acétique est un peu forte à mon goût, mais on retrouve également un beau caractère de vieille cave et dagrumes. Acidité lactique et acétique dintensité moyenne à forte. Intéressant!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dorst, Eizeringen 25/04. Pours a dirty deep yellow. Fluid lemon and lime orgy, made palateable with a lieblich-oilier mouthfeel than usual. Citrus zest notes coming from the aged hops remain flavourfully distinguishable from the other acidic registers of funk.

(draught) pours a hazy deep golden colour with no head. aroma of bread dough, cherry stones, honey, some light yeast, earth, balsamic vinegar and lime. flavour is mostly bread dough and lemon juice, with a medium tartness, some grass and coconut milk. medium-bodied with very soft carbonation.

Sample at Nacht van de Grote Dorst, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: little sweet, brett, wood, sour.
TASTE: sour, lactic, very dry, wood, amazing!

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 At WE of Spontaneous Fermentation. Slightly hazy golden with no head and no lacing. Aroma is lemony, grassy and with cheesy notes. Taste is also lemony and grassy with light funk and cheesy notes. Medium body. Light carbonation. Dry. More funk and deepness and the funk.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 On cask at WoSF. Clear pale yellow pour. Lemony, cheesy aroma. Taste is tart, cheesy, lemony, grassy finish. Like the jong, this one is quite lemony but more rounded with more lambicy funk. Dry palate, light mineral carb. Not bad at all.
2013.08.17 - Gents Bierfestival - mengeling van jonge lambiek en oude lambiek gerijpt op porto-vaten -neus : zeer fruitig, druiven - mond : iets zurig, groene appeltjes

Bottle late night around the campfire shared by Mike. I say around the campfire, but it was shortly after opening this that a very large man came by and told us to extinguish our fire. Immediately. I blame those fuckers who set the dumpster on fire. They ruined fires for everyone. Thanks dumpster fuckers. Anyway, this pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Big funk and cheesy notes. Medium bodied, tart and funky. Chewy and tart. Lovely. Long acid and funk. Lemony acid.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 21.04.2013, 2 year old sample handpumped directly from a portwine barrel @ the brewery on Toer de Geuze:
Big longlasting head. Aroma is so incredibly fresh, lemon, hay, apples, citrus peel, some wood and yeast. Taste is pretty sour, insanely fresh, lemon, hay, citrus peel, wood, grass and a little dried fruit. This is so easy drinking! I just cant say how much I loved this one. It was so out of the blue, totally unexpected. Even though Timmermans regained a lot of my respect, I still wish they could just bottle this directly, instead of destroying this good shit by blending it. Even a limited edition would be better than nothing...

2 year old, draft at Timmermans, during TdG 2013. It pours hazy golden with a massive white head. The nose is wheat, light farmyard, wood and a touch of vanilla. The taste is clean tartness, lemon, sherbet, wheat, wood, mild acidity, mouth-puckering tartness and lime juice with a dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation and moderate tartness. Smooth, yet rather sour. Pretty tasty.
Clear dark golden color, flat.  Aroma of musty blankets, dusty lemon.  Taste is sour and acidic citrus, dusty finish.

2 yr sample @ Timmermans during TdG 13. The pours slightly hazy gold with a pretty lively white head. The nose is butterscoth, lemon, yellow apples. Full barnyard, sheepskin, musty white grape. The taste is quite woody and assertive. Quite a bit of lip-puckering lemon. Sharp oaky finish. Soft body, smooth. Overall, pretty decent.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Dry barnyard and brett. Dry and citric. Tart and orangebfruity. Dry finish. Tart.
Dag van de Lambik @ Verzekering tegen de grote dorst. Very refreshing lambik, no carbonation. Sour and dry, some bitterness in aftertaste. Good!

Enjoyed at the 2012 Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. This is an unblended Lambiek direct from the brewery. Served in 2 ounce pours.

A - SRM of 8. Pretty clear and easily seen through

S - honey and fresh cut grass. Pineapple. Chewing gum.  Spearmint? For sure a minty quality to this

T - whoa. Sour bomb!! Vinegar apples and orange. Very light mint taste compared to the nose which lead me to think this was a lot more minty.

M - medium. Incredible smooth and dry finish.

O - 5/5. Pretty damn good. Nice and reshing. I ordered a 2nd one.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 26/V/2012 - on tap @ WoSF 2012 (Opstal) - 18 months old (2012-536) 
Clear copper orange beer, noe head. Aroma: very minty (King Pepper Mints, not Menthos), some citrus, little chemical. MF: no carbon, light to medium body. Taste: nice sour start, more of that minty thing, lime zest, lime juice, pretty sour. Aftertaste: little bitter, lemony, dry ending.

On draught at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a dark golden colour with no head. Aroma of wet cardboard, horse blanket, lemon and oak. Similar flavours and very tart with lingering pickled onions. Very low carbonation and an oily mouth-feel.

draft @ WoSF 2012 // 18 months old // clear apple yellow, zero head // smell is sufficiently tart, tart acidic apple cider blended with lemon peel, hint of mould, almost touch booze on the nose // taste is mellow acidic apples, dash acidic cider, overall getting to reasonably tart, harsh acidic finish, lemons & touch lemon peels, briefly the body thins out very closely to the finish // completely flat, medium bodied // a nice one from a brewery that mostly focuses on crappy sweetened ones

Slightly hazy, golden yellow colour. No head. Fruity aroma, malts, light tart, some wheat. Light sweet flavour, light tart, quite fruity. Light cloying mouthfeel, light sweet finish with light yoghurt/lactic acid. Quite nice.
(Draught -as oude lambik- @ De Nacht van de Grote Dorst, Eizeringen)

3 years old, from tap @Timmermans as Timmermans Aechte Lambik. Headless. Clear copper golden. Low aroma level. A fine rounded fruitiness with a gentle sourness. Surprisingly sweet-flavored.  A refined sweetness with a note of tart apples and citrus fruits.  Light to medium full. Rounded acidic-sweet fruit ending. Appealing.

Etwas wässrig, leicht säuerlich, relativ holzig. Die Säuerlichkeit nimmt minimal zu, etwas kratzig, unspektakulär. 	 
Test vom 12.8.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: -,9,9,9,-,9 - 9,00
Floral honey and light basement aroma.  Clear golden yellow color with no head.  Tart weedy grass malt flavor.  Light astringent finish.  Weird - this seems to be somewhere between a jonge and oude.
Draught at WSF 2009, Buggenhout, Belgium  Slightly hazy body.  Citric, musty, wood aroma.  Moderately sour, lightly bitter flavour (quite citric).  Balance is very nice.
Draught at WSF. Slight hazy straw coloured with no head. Spicy aroma with notes of balsamic vinegar, wood and grapefruit. Flavour is fruity with some musty notes. Citric, woody and a little thin.
(Draught, 2yr vintage)  Pours a clear yellow body with no head.  Aroma of lemon peel, earth, and light grapefruit.  Flavor of grapefruit, apple, and earthiness.
Murky apple juice with tartness.  Very tart, refreshing example with lemony, grapefruity notes.  Complex, tart, full-bodied and quite well balanced.  Delicious.
WSF. Hazy gold and flat. Some bandaid in the aroma as well as wood and white grape juice. Has a thin but not a bad body. Acidic. Nice and mellow, though, with lemon and apples. Pretty good.
Tap @ WSF. Pours a clear yellow with no head. Sweet and citric nose. Tart, fruity, woody,  mouldy and some almond. Not a winner.
Cloudy orange with no head. Aroma of wood, funk and oak, the latter with a touch of coconut. Dry and tart funky flavour with a fruity pineapple note.

Draught at Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008: Hazy gold with orange highlights and no head. Low tart fruits with hay and citrus. Vinous and low wood notes hideout in the back with some peach. Flavor is more woody and acetic than the aroma, but still low. Very smooth and mild for the style. Peach crops up again with some citrus peel. Some metallic notes at the end.  A bit light on all the essential flavors... but not bad.
Draught @ Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008. Clear deep golden with no head. Mild sour with notes of hay, wood and barnyard. Lacks carbonation.

Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008.  2 years old.  Clear, still light amber color.  Light hay and sweet malts in the nose.  Mild lemon tartness throughout, with some more mild wheat, hay and honey malt flavors.  A bit simple but certainly drinkable.

A Mes rate: Draught at weekend of tarts.Phone rate as I was wandering around so the notes are a little thin on the ground. A white wine tinged young lambic. Slight barrel notes. Lacking character. Ok for a quick nip but wouldnt choose to drink any more of it.

Light hazy, yellow color, no head. Neutral start, just light sweet and light fruity. Sour fruity (banana) finish. Sticky mouthfeel. No oak, no complexity. Guess it was not that old.

Draught yesterday @ Weekend Spontanious Ferm.
Hazy goldne color, no head.
Aromz fruits, malts.
Medium body.
Taste good soft sourness, malts, bit sweet, refreshing, little woods.
A lambic for first taste of this style.
Draught @ WSF. Pale gold with no head. Aroma of apricot and apple. Tastes is slightly sweet with honey, barley, lemon and some white wine character. Acidic and medium bodied. Not great.
On tap @ Weekend Of Spontaneous Fermentation 07. Light and refershing - kinda ciderish with notes of fruit and wood - easy to drink.
Spontanious weekend 07... Hazy Yellow ... Sweet vinegar nose ... slightly sweet wine vinegar.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Of Spontaneous Fermentation. Hazy orange colour, no head. Aroma is sour and quite strongly vinegarish (almost horsepissish). Flavour is sweetish sour as well as quite wooden.

Unclear golden brown not to beautiful body; Very strange not to pleasant potato, vinegar nose; The body is almost a bit thick like cold thin The with sugar, a little sour, very simple; Quite long acetic and lactic sour finish, potato and cold The with sugar aromas. Not really pleasant or elegant, it doesnt seem finishes eighter.

Draught at weekend of spontanious fermentation.
Hazy golden coloured with a small head.
Light acidic aroma of fruits and apples.
Acidic flavour of fruits, apples and wood.

Draught @ 16th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007, Optal. Unclear orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is light sour. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. A bit boring !

Spontanious weekend 07. Notes say: Similar to de troch lambic in that its a bit overly malty, however there are sour hints and tart fruit making a show, quite balanced. Theres a small woo hoo undr the ratring, i dont think its for the rating but it doesnt make sence for anything else?
A nice tasting lambic from draft tasted at the beerfestival at buggenhout in may 2007. Medium bosied

Pale straw colour, no head. Nose of chaff, grain, lactic. Taste: this is pure wort. Virtually no acidity. Not bad in se, but totally unacceptable for this type. There's just some lemon-flavour retronasal. the aftertaste is much better than the rest - thank God. Medium-bodied, yes. Substandard for lambic.
